name: Daniel Campbell
text: Did a good job at a reasonable price.

name: Cynthia Wilson
text: This is my go to company for carpet cleaning! Excellent service!

name: jolene Crabtree
text: Great guys and professional

name: Tinderly Johnson
text: Steve was awesome.  He did an excellent job.  This was the second time he's come out to clean our carpets.  The first time was about 4-5 years ago and he did even better this time.  We chose Chem-Dry again because of Steve's professionalism, punctuality and excellent service.  He did a great job last time and did even better today.

resp.text: Tinderly, we truly appreciate your comments and continuing to use our cleaning service. Steven does work hard and cares about the work he does. Thank you for choosing Huntsville Chem-Dry.

name: E A
text: Stephan was very detailed and professional in the process

resp.text: Thank you Eric for choosing Huntsville ChemDry to clean your sofa. I hope you had a great holiday weekend. Tara

name: Danielle Dillon
text: Stephan did a great job on our carpets! We will definitely use him again!

resp.text: Thank you for choosing Huntsville ChemDry. Have a wonderful holiday weekend. Tara

name: Linda Muzquiz
text: I am so lucky to have found Huntsville Chem-Dry!! From the moment I contacted them using their online contact form, I have been impressed with their responsiveness and ease of scheduling the pick up and return of my carpets. I had two runners and a large round carpet cleaned, I have two beautiful dachshunds so I had them cleaned for possible urine stains, just to be on the safe side… To my delight, they contacted me just 5 days later to let me know my carpets were cleaned and ready to be returned! I was expecting a couple of weeks based on experience with other rug cleaning companies. I will definitely be using their services again and again and highly recommend them!! They were a joy to work with, very sweet and friendly, and I am a very satisfied customer!!

resp.text: Thank you Linda. I know the dogs will be happy to have their rugs back to play on and under!  Speaking with you today made my day. Thank you for your service and congratulations on your upcoming retirement. Cheers to your next adventure!  Tara

name: Taylor Walding
text: We bought a house that previously had 2 dogs and a cat in it, but we don’t have animals because I’m allergic. Hence calling in the professionals to clean before we moved in. What kind of carpet cleaning company doesn’t vacuum first? I paid nearly $500 to have my carpets cleaned and there was pet hair left everywhere afterward. The owner and the local guy were rude to me on multiple occasions. I had to follow up several times to get them to come back and fix it. I was originally quoted $350 which ended up being $450 when he arrived. That’s fine - but then they refused to correct the problem at no charge. I told them that was fine, but I’d be leaving a negative review to warn others. After several back and forths, they finally caved and he agreed to vacuum again. He then refused to vacuum the upstairs (which was about half the job) claiming “it looks fine to me.” He then had the audacity to complain to me about “getting him in trouble” by telling the owner he gave me the sanitizer for free. How was I supposed to know he wasn’t allowed to do that? I figured that was a nice bonus they occasionally threw in free. If he got in trouble, that’s the natural consequence of his voluntary actions - not my fault for mentioning it on the phone while trying to sort things out. Pretty bad experience overall, but the carpets are clean now.

resp.text: Taylor, thank you for your feedback. I am glad that the technician was finally able to get back out there for you. I do apologize for putting you in that awkward situation after you said that he gave you free sanitizer and you left him a tip. I don’t have a problem that he gave you the free sanitizer but that should have been in his notes so I was aware None of that was your fault at all and again I apologize.

name: Tina Close
text: Steven arrived early and was extremely efficient. Great results and would definitely utilize this business again.

resp.text: Tina, thank you for choosing Huntsville ChemDry to clean and sanitize your carpets. We truly enjoy being the healthy home experts for our clients and their pets. Have a great week!  Tara

name: Karen Ogrady
text:
From the minute Stephan came to my home he was professional and so very knowledgeable
I will definitely be calling him back
Such a pleasure

resp.text:
Thank you Karen.  I'm glad we were able to take care of your carpet cleaning so quickly.  Have a wonderful week.
Tara

name: Rhonda Stoner
text:
Tara was welcoming and professional from the moment she answered the phone. I had used Chem Dry in Decatur before they closed the Decatur office. Normally the Huntsvile franchise does not service Decatur, but Tara came up with a solution. We also cleaned the carpet at my husband’s office while they were in our area.

Stephen, the technician was professional and kind, plus he worked hard to ensure he got several stubborn stains out of our carpet.

I highly recommend Huntsville Chem Dry.
The cost was worth every penny I spent.

resp.text:
Thank you Rhonda for your kind words. No one ever mentions me in the reviews just the cleaning that we do so you just made my day!!  Let me know when you’re ready for your tile cleaning. Have an amazing day.
Tara

name: Bryan L Gassaway
text: My wife and I have been using Chem-Dry for many years.  We love how their professionalism, promptness, and value.  Their technicians discussed which stains are be hard to remove at the beginning (to set expectations) and tried their best to remove them.

resp.text: Bryan, thank you for trusting in Huntsville Chem-Dry and choosing our service and we hope to service you again in the future.

name: Robyn Gallagher
text: I will tell you I have used other companies for my carpets and tile and has been awful. Stephen came over and was amazing! Was so kind and explained exactly what he was going to do. Did a perfect job. Won’t use anybody else but Huntsville Chem Dry for sure.

resp.text: Thank you Robyn. We’re so happy you chose Huntsville ChemDry to make your home a clean & healthy environment. Have a great weekend.

name: Paula Smith
text:
I was very pleased with the service provided by Chem-Dry. Tim and Stephen did an awesome job removing and cleaning a polish build up from my tile floors. Thanks, for the prompt, courteous, and professional service. I would highly recommend Chem-Dry.

Paula Smith

resp.text: Very happy we could take care of that for you. Over counter polish is applied all the time to natural wood floor, engineered wood floor and LVT by mistake. It may look good or great for a little while but eventually it will break down or look hazy. Once you start the polish hamster wheel it’s hard to get off. We can safely remove the polish and return your flooring to its natural original condition. You being a realtor I’m sure you may see this in homes and very common, now you know it can be fixed!  Thank you for choosing Huntsville Chem-Dry!

name: Reginald Snell
text: We were lucky enough to get Steve to perform the service of cleaning and sealing our tile and granite. He was very hard working, professional and personable. Thank you ChemDry!

resp.text: Thank you Reginald. I’m so happy that we were able to seal the tile/ grout and granite countertops for you and Audrey. Have a great day.

name: Sergio Flores
text: I needed my carpet cleaned  and I thought I give them a call and got say they did a great job. Spotless and great service

resp.text: Sergio, thank you for trusting Huntsville Chem-Dry to take care of the spots and spills in your carpet. Always know were here for you anytime.

name: Erin
text: I was very happy with the service provided by ChemDry. Making the appointment was easy. They were straightforward when explaining their services. The technician, Stephan, called me when he was on his way, which minimized my time away from work. He was friendly and thorough when conducting the walk-through and explained exactly what he would be doing. I was very pleased with the results. No complaints.

resp.text:
Thank you so much.  I also really appreciate that you called today to make sure you got the technician's name correct.  I will make sure he sees this.  Have a great evening.

Tara Outson
Owner, Huntsville ChemDry

name: Maria Huck
text: Stephan did a great job on my carpet and sofa. He arrived on time and was courteous and respectful.  Will definitely use again.

resp.text: Hi Maria, we are so pleased you chose to use our cleaning company. For future reference we also clean hardwood floors, area rugs and tile. Thank you for choosing Huntsville Chem-dry.

name: Glenette Brodzinski
text: I read online about how Chemdry could remove pet odors out of carpets. I read reviews of how great they do. I looked at the ads for discounts and specials. $39. A room, 50% off of pet odor treatment!  Sounded great. I called and explained that I have 4 area rugs that needed pet odor cleaning. That three of them are very inexpensive synthetic rugs and one was a little better grade, wool rug.  She took just a minute to give me a quote. With my 50% off special, it would only be $2600. !!!  WHAT!  I could buy bigger better then I have rugs for that price!!  I have a company that I have used before that picked up and returned, did a great job, for $300. a rug. These rugs are not worth that cost!  Much less over $600 per rug!! AND THATS THE 50% OFF price! God help anyone that needs to clean their rugs when they don’t have a special on!!  No thanks. I can buy new rugs for that price!!!

resp.text:
Glenette, I am sorry that we were not able to help you when you called today for an estimate.  The $2600 was to clean and remove the pet urine odor out of 5 large rugs.  The cleaning of rugs is much different than carpet cleaning and urine removal.  We cannot clean rugs with pet urine in the home as you do not want your hardwood floors to get wet.  In our facility the rugs go through many steps to be cleaned properly (dusting machine, submersion bath, centrifuge, hung in drying room and then any fringe is repaired).  I do understand that our cleaning method is more expensive than what some people pay for synthetic rugs.  As I stated on the phone earlier today, please do not let someone treat the urine issues in our home.  You want to protect your hardwoods.  Enjoy the rest of your weekend.

Tara Outson
Owner, Huntsville Chem-Dry

name: jennifer vinson
text: We were so pleased with the results of our cleaning!  Even though there were several stained areas which required more detailed cleaning, the carpet was dry within a few hours. Would recommend Chem-Dry to anyone.

resp.text: Jennifer, glad you were pleased with the cleaning! We are used to tackling the tough stains, if we can't get them out, no one else can. It was a pleasure working for you and hope to again in the future. Thank you for choosing Huntsville Chem-Dry for your carpet cleaning needs.

name: Michel Bouvier
text: Our carpet had been cleaned once before using a dry process but the result was less than satisfactory. The Chem-Dry cleaning process proved to be much better then the previous dry process. All the spots that the dry process could not removed were removed and did not return using the Chem-Dry process. Also, the carpet once cleaned had no smell or visible residue and was dry within 2 hours. We are very satisfied and will call on Chem-Dry to clean our carpets in the future.

resp.text: Michel, thank you for choosing Huntsville Chem-Dry and just to clarify, our cleaning process is a wet clean but we use a lot less water than many steam cleaning companies and still provide a deep extraction cleaning pulling out the moisture we put into the carpet with our advanced cleaning equipment and amplified extraction. The moisture that does remain dries in about 2 to 3 hours.  And we never leave any kind of soap or residue in your carpet so this cleaning should last a lot longer for you. Once again it was a pleasure meeting you and we hope to be of service to you again in the future. Maybe your upholstery next time! Thank you.

name: Kay Lewis
text: The service I received from Chem-Dry Huntsville was superior. The technician arrived on time, offered me advice on products and services, but was not hard sell. He worked diligently for more than 2 hours and then left without a trace, except for my sparkling clean and fresh carpet. I will definitely use Chem-Dry again.

resp.text: Kay, thank you so much for your kind words.  I will make sure I let Adam know what you said about him.  Have a great day.

name: jennifer vinson
text: We were so pleased with the results of our cleaning!  Even though there were several stained areas which required more detailed cleaning, the carpet was dry within a few hours. Would recommend Chem-Dry to anyone.

resp.text: Jennifer, glad you were pleased with the cleaning! We are used to tackling the tough stains, if we can't get them out, no one else can. It was a pleasure working for you and hope to again in the future. Thank you for choosing Huntsville Chem-Dry for your carpet cleaning needs.

name: Susan Simons
text:
Overall it was a good job of cleaning my carpet that is fairly new but heavily soiled by my dog.  It smells and looks great and Steve worked very hard to clean thoroughly and comply with requests.  He was also fair about giving me the best price he could.  A couple of things I would say could be improved - Steve was not provided anything by Chem-Dry to put under my heavy sofas to protect the legs since those could not be moved out of the room.  In the past, the company we used had some plastic squares.  Steve used plastic grocery bags from Target that I provided him and one faded the red onto the carpet but it is in an obscure place that is not noticeable.  Also it would seem ideal to have 2 people working the job vs. one because of better control of the long hoses, etc. which dripped some moisture and dirt from someone else's house onto my hardwood foyer.  Not preferred but not a big deal either.  Also, I signed the paperwork at the end without reading the words written, just the price.
Later, my husband read it and asked me why the work was not guaranteed against the stains coming back, etc.  I plan to call and ask them about that.  Hopefully the stains won't come back so a moot point.
I would recommend just the basic cleaning plus any pet stain treatment for rooms that might have pet soiling.  The basic formula is supposedly with baking soda and that is truly all natural.  There were options to buy two add-ons in the cleaning formula - an anti-microbial spray and a scotch-guard product.  I opted out on these 2 and don't think there were beneficial.  In fact have read that scotch-guard can be harmful to health.
Also, if you are expecting this service to have very little moisture after cleaning, not really so.  Even un-pet-treated rooms needed overnight to completely dry to move furniture back and my cleaning started at 11:00 am ish.
Have a great day!

resp.text:
Susan, Thank you for your comments & for choosing Huntsville Chem-Dry to serve you.  We always strive for 5-star reviews but we welcome the opportunity to learn & improve from other reviews.  Your input is very valuable.  I want a take a minute or two to clarify a few things.
It is standard that we provide plastic tabs for furniture legs so I am embarrassed to hear that we did not have them on the van that day.  Plastic bags are not acceptable & I apologize for the inconvenience.
We run one man crews on the van to help keep the cleaning costs lower for our customers.
Our paperwork & signature is an agreement confirming our price before the work begins & our agreement that we will do everything we can to remove stains but we cannot guarantee complete stain removal.
We do have 3 packages to choose from, our Basic Cleaning, our Stain Fighter Package & our Healthy Home Package.  Our Chem-Dry proprietary cleaning solution is called The Natural.  It is not like baking soda but it is a Green-Certified cleaning agent.  It is a wonderful product that does not leave a dirt attracting residue and has amazing cleaning abilities while still being safe to drink (tastes awful though)!  Our Stain Fighter package consists of co-applying the stain protectant (another Green-Certified product called PowerGuard) with the cleaning.  Scotchguard is a brand of protectant that is toxic but we pride ourselves on using safe products for the home.  Re-applying stain protectant is very important to extend the look of your carpets.  The original protectant wears off over time with vacuuming and normal activities.  You mentioned that yours is fairly new so it's always good to re-apply once a year on average, this will make cleaning up spills or muddy paws so easy on you in between professional cleanings.  Most companies spray some kind of protectant on the carpet after cleaning which creates a crusty top layer.  Our co-application of the protectant allows us to protect the entire carpet fiber, not just the top.  Our Healthy Home package is the combination of the cleaning, the protectant and an Ant-Microbial pre-spray which removes bacteria in the carpet (especially if there are pets).
Results can vary with drying times in carpet depending on how dirty it is and what kind of carpet it is.  2-3 hours is average but we run our cleaning machine until the carpet is clean without soaking the carpet pad & we use a powerful extraction method for the best possible results.
Again, thank you Susan for your recommendations & please let me know if I can help in any way.

Tara Outson
Owner, Huntsville Chem-Dry

name: Cindy Stewart
text: Chem-Dry made our ten year old carpet look brand new.  I was very impressed by the professionalism and expertise of our technician that cleaned our carpet.  I recommend them to anyone who needs cleaner carpet.  We decided to let them clean our carpet yearly after this great job!

resp.text: Cindy, we thank you so much for choosing Huntsville Chem-Dry and recognizing the difference, comparing our cleaning process to other companies. We hope to serve you for years to come!

name: E A
text: Stephan was very detailed and professional in the process

resp.text: Thank you Eric for choosing Huntsville ChemDry to clean your sofa. I hope you had a great holiday weekend. Tara

text:
I am very pleased with the cleaning of my carpet.
The carpet was not wet, all the stains were removed and the carpet was only moist when the job was completed.  Your service person was very professional, knowledgeable and  attentive to the job.  He was late for the appointment due to the fact that he was the only service person and some jobs ahead of my appointment  took him longer than expected.

I recommend the company to have more service persons in my area.

resp.text: Carolyn, Thank you for your comments and input. We do apologize our technician was running late that day but that can happen occasionally. We hope to be of service to you in the future as well and thank you for choosing Huntsville Chem-Dry.

text: We were lucky enough to get Steve to perform the service of cleaning and sealing our tile and granite. He was very hard working, professional and personable. Thank you ChemDry!

resp.text: Thank you Reginald. I’m so happy that we were able to seal the tile/ grout and granite countertops for you and Audrey. Have a great day.

name: Jacke James-Raines
text: Excellent job by Chem-Dry!  I requested a quote and service and received both in the same day.  That was totally unexpected and very much appreciated!  Scott did an excellent job on the carpet and helped with an awful odor and fabric stains on a couch skirt.  Overall superb job--BRAVO!

resp.text: Thank you for your business for your upholstery cleaning needs from Huntsville Chem-Dry.

name: Ann Tippie
text: Aaron Johnston arrived on time and did a fantastic job of cleaning my furniture. He was very concerned about a couple of pieces, as to whether the colors would bleed. He moved the chair and sofa in my family room on top of the area rug to clean them. This was to protect my wood floors. Afterward, he cleaned the rug. He was very personable and I believe a great representative for your company.

resp.text: Thank you for recognizing the extra efforts our staff will take to provide a quality home service, from Huntsville Chem-Dry.

name: Linda Underwood
text: Customer service was great and the work and tech was excellent..  I was quoted $200 over original quote and did pay$100.00 over original quote over the phone.  That was for a standard couch ,love seat and chair plus a small lobby type couch..  I can no longer afford the services and I have supported Chem Dry for many many years ..$300.00 is just too much for what I needed done.

resp.text: Linda, we do appreciate your business over the years and I think there maybe some confusion as to what was discussed on the phone and what was added on during the appointment which did increase the price. Cleaning upholstery is something we do very well, and it is detailed and time consuming. We clean some upholstery that other companies turn down and we still get very good results so the pricing for this kind of service is at a premium.

name: Corey Jobman
text: Scott was the man that arrived on time and was very friendly. Everything was explained very well about how the cleaning process worked and makes me wish I would have used them a long time ago. My carpet looks and feels very clean. The carpet took about 3 hours to dry but never really felt too wet anyway. This was a much better service experience from Chem-Dry than what I have used in the past and I will only use them from now on.

resp.text: Thank you for trusting Huntsville Chem-Dry in your home and we hope to serve you again in the future!

name: Plothole
text: Got a new house with a previous cat owner. After a quick call to Chem Dry the next day the house was cleaned and my allergy friend couldn't even tell I cat had ever lived here. They do great work and very fast as well!

resp.text: Allergy relief is our specialty along with pet odor removal. Our deep extraction cleaning process is powerful and very effective compared to the cleaning process from other companies. Thank you!

name: Logan Robinson
text: Great service!  I have my carpet cleaned on a regular basis and am most pleased with Chem-Dry.  Scott was on time, very thorough, and did an excellent job.  I will definitely use them again.

resp.text: Logan, thank you for using our service. It's wonderful to have you as a repeat customer, Thank You!

name: Cindy Stewart
text: Chem-Dry made our ten year old carpet look brand new.  I was very impressed by the professionalism and expertise of our technician that cleaned our carpet.  I recommend them to anyone who needs cleaner carpet.  We decided to let them clean our carpet yearly after this great job!

resp.text: Cindy, we thank you so much for choosing Huntsville Chem-Dry and recognizing the difference, comparing our cleaning process to other companies. We hope to serve you for years to come!

name: Janice Mullen
text: Recently had our carpets cleaned by Chem-Dry and they all looked great.  Aaron  was very polite and answered all our questions about the process.  We will definitely use them again if needed.

resp.text: Janice, We thank you for choosing our company Huntsville Chem-Dry, and we hope to be your go to company for years to come. We also clean upholstery, oriental rugs, also tile and grout. You can also expect to receive a 10% automatic repeat customer discount for your next service. Thank You!

name: Steven B.
text:
Steve did a fantastic job of cleaning my carpets of the house I just bought. I called Chem-Dry up at 8:07 am on a Saturday and by 11:30 he was there. I showed him the rooms, he measured, we agreed upon the very reasonable price, and he got to work.

He was done in about 1.5 hours from start to finish and the carpets look great. No residue and the carpets were dry in under 3 hours.

I've used other services in the area to clean my carpets but Chem-Dry did the best job!

10/10 WILL USE THEM AGAIN.

Thank you!

resp.text:
Thank you so much Steven.  Good luck in your new home.

Tara

name: Carmen Hurter
text:
Edit to original post. Since leaving my review ChemDry did contact me and sent someone out to re-clean the areas at no charge. I appreciate the customer service in addressing the review and trying to make us happy with the experience. Thank you!

The service provided was good however we were less than impressed with the results. My husband and I did some of the floors ourselves by hand before we hired ChemDry and those actually turned out better and lighter than having them professionally cleaned. For almost $700 we were hardly able to tell a difference. Most disappointingly, ChemDry contacted me asking me to leave a review. I contacted them back letting them know our issues hoping someone would reach out if they actually cared about my mediocre experience. After waiting 2 weeks I decided to go ahead and post about it here because they never reached out.

resp.text: Carmen,  I did leave a message that very day to see what we could do.  I left it with the number ending in ..43.  I am very sorry, maybe I have the number incorrect in the computer.  I will email you.  Thank you for this feedback.

name: Niki Ward
text: He was really great - nice young man and very professional. My sofa and carpets look brand new!!! I highly recommend Chem-Dry!

resp.text: Thank you for allowing us to provide service to you. We send out a reminder card in 6 months as a reminder for your carpet cleaning or upholstery cleaning needs.

name: Tom Lockard
text: Excellent job had house that belonged to my uncle and carpet was in real bad shape Chem Dru got it clean amazing job looks better than I hoped it would ; highly recommend if you need carpet cleaning service

resp.text: Tom, thanks for choosing Huntsville Chem-Dry and glad we saved you potentially thousands of dollars from having to replace the carpet.

name: Gina Barlow
text: Steven did a fantastic job.   Not only did he remove the stain out of a chair, he explained the process thoroughly and was very professional, courteous and respectful.

resp.text:
Gina,

Thank you for choosing Huntsville Chem-Dry. Stephen is our top technician with over 15 years of experience and he does such a great job. He is also experienced in carpet stretching and repairs.

name: Tonya Walls
text: After the cleaning, a nice clean scent engulfed the entire office! Very pleased with the results!

resp.text: Glad we could help your situation, just a note we did apply a deodorizer for the cleaning, normally our cleaning process is odorless. But all of our products are Eco friendly as well.

name: Debbie Price
text: Great customer service, very knowledgeable and I'm very pleased.  I will be using Chem-Dry again the next time I need it.  Thanks!

resp.text: Thank you Debbie for choosing Huntsville Chem-Dry. It was nice meeting you and we will see you next time.

name: Shirley Sampayo
text: Excellent work done by the tech. He was respectful and knowledgeable.

resp.text: Thank you for choosing Huntsville Chem-Dry!

name: Melissa Smith
text: I tried to get a quote from Chem-Dry recently that left me with a negative impression of the company. I'm not quite sure what went wrong, but the owner, who answered the phone, was brusque and acted as if I was wasting her time... although I spent less than 3 minutes talking to her and only inquired about 2 things. I have a medical condition that makes it hard to speak quickly or process the speech of others, maybe that's where we got off on the wrong foot. Anyway, I tried to ask about the price for one room and a couple of other spots throughout the house. I was confused when she told me the price would be $135, as the website says a living room is $55. I asked her about it, and she told me the minimum is $135. That would have been fine (even though other companies I've called either do not have a minimum or have a smaller minimum), but the attitude behind the comment was if she was talking to a clueless employee rather than a potential customer. Wouldn't you get more customers if you spoke pleasantly and said something like, "I'm sorry about that. Although we'd like to serve as many clients as possible, because of our high quality service, our overhead to come out for less than the price of 3 rooms wouldn't allow us to stay open for business." rather than "No. There's a $135 minimum." in a rather snotty and abrupt tone? Because I had wondered why they weren't listed with the BBB, I asked if they were considering registering with them. I actually wasn't planning on asking about that, but I needed a minute to think after the first part of the conversation went so poorly. Things only got worse. In the same 'you're an idiot, leave me alone' tone, she said "All that means is that you paid them a yearly fee." So after this friendly and pleasant interaction, I told her thank you anyway and hung up. I'd work on my customer interactions if I were this business owner. Who knows, maybe she was having an off-morning, or maybe my voice reminded her of someone she didn't like. Hopefully that's the case and you'll have a more agreeable and satisfying experience than I did.

resp.text:
Melissa,

Thank you for bringing this to my attention.  I really had no idea how I was coming across on our phone call.  I am deeply sorry for that.  Our website does show that if you are getting a living room cleaned that the price for that room is $55.  Underneath that it also shows that our minimum charge is $119.  I will take your suggests to heart and thank you again for letting me know.  I don't ever want anyone feeling that way again.  Have a great weekend.

Tara Outson
Owner, Huntsville ChemDry

text: On August 22nd 2018 my home suffered massive water damage due to broken water pipes.  State Farm agent/adjuster hired Landmark Construction to make the repairs. name: Eric Echols
text: Was unable to help me or give me a quote. Interior and exterior was looked at and I was hopeful. Even if insurance didn't cover it, we knew it had to be repaired. The person that did the initial visit was professional. Disappointed I could not get help with the matter or receive a quote. If they could not fix or repair it, a referral would have been nice.

resp.text: I inspected the roof damage and interior water damage on the fireplace wall for Mr. Echols.  Mr. Echols also had me look at the back side of the house where there was rotten siding that covered the entire rear elevation. I had my roofer go by and do an inspection on the roof and he identified that the existing top layer of roofing also had a roll roof installed under the top layer of roofing indicating that a repair has been attempted in the past already on this issue and considering the complexity of the repair and how extensive it would be to repair the water leak completely and with a warranty,  I then contacted Mr. Echols with the information. Mr. Echols informed me that replacing the entire front slope (which is what was required in order to perform this task correctly where a warranty could come with the work) he informed me that it would be to much for him to do. I informed Mr. Echols that a simple repair could not be done and also explained to him that Landmark does not like to get into performing repairs behind other trades that had already failed the first time. Mr. Echols then said that he would go elsewhere for another Estimate. -David

text: Very upset with this place. with repairs on roof. 2 different times. My insurance referred them and now were having to pay for it now. They might be good with other things but roofing is a negative.I was told after fixing a area that leaked again and charged that they have to make some money. We learned our lesson the hard way.

name: Jess Palmer
text:
This company takes the phrase "cutting corners" to new, literal levels. If you get nothing else from my review, get this: use anyone but Landmark.

This company dragged my relatively small project on for months. The employees are nice enough, but are unbelievably slow and inept. More than once, I had to call the main office to "tattle" on Ben, the project manager, who had gone totally AWOL and would not communicate despite my house being in complete disarray thanks to his project management.

Installing quarter round proved too difficult for this company. They had to come out over 4 separate times to complete this job. They literally skipped parts of the wall because there was furniture or a floor mat in front of it. They skipped the kitchen entirely. And when they did return to install it there, they literally just left giant gaps in each corner without joining the pieces together. They were dumbfounded that I wanted the quarter round to join at the corners. WTF!

They destroyed 2 toilet lids by putting tools on them.  They re-seated toilets crooked and rocking and leaking.  They left the closet bolts uncovered and did a caulking job you'd expect from a toddler.

There are places in the laminate floor with visible gaps between planks. There were gouges in it that they filled with wood filler and called it a day. They did a sloppy paint job in both bathrooms (at least they got the color right, though).

It was unbelievable how many times these people had to come back to my house to fix their screw-ups and even now, a year later, I'm still finding fresh, mind-boggling issues.

If you care about your house at all, use someone else.

I would like to add that the owner of the company did reach out to me within 24 hours of my review with apologies and an offer to make it right. I declined, however, on the basis that I have no faith in them being capable of doing any of this job.

resp.text:
Thank you for taking the time to communicate to us why our service did not meet your expectations. Please accept our sincerest apologies for any trouble or inconvenience we have caused you. We have every desire to address your needs and provide the best solution available to resolve your issues as soon as possible. Unfortunately, during our phone conversation on May 30, 2019, you informed us that you would not allow us the opportunity to resolve your issues.
In the event that you allow us to make matters right, please contact us at our office number (901-452-0390).

name: Lauren Russell
text: The Landmark Water mitigation crew saved us this week! Following a sizable water leak, the ceiling in our living room collapsed. I immediately called our Landmark contractor, who immediately dispatched the mitigation crew. Our ceiling collapsed at 5:30 and the crew was onsite within 35 minutes. They worked efficiently, moving our furniture and cleaning up the mountains of insulation. Jacob (the team leader) and the rest of his crew was top notch. They were kind and so easy to work with. In the following days, as Jacob monitored the drying, when he said he would be at my house at a certain time—- he showed up right when he promised. No four hour window of waiting which was so nice! The communication was above expectation and these guys made a less than desirable situation tolerable. I’m so thankful for Landmark, the water mitigation crew, our contractor, and Jacob!

resp.text: Thank you Lauren for the outstanding review and trusting Landmark in your time of need. It was a pleasure working with you and James.

text:
From beginning to end, working with Enviroco has been a nightmare. A year later and we are still dealing with their mess.

The work that was completed was always half way done. It would take multiple calls/emails to management to get the job completed. For example, thorough cleanup of sewer contamination was suppose to be fully completed and days later we found contaminated soiled toilet paper in areas of the basement.

Numerous items that were taken from our home during the cleanup process were either brought back broken or missing altogether. Once Enviroco was made aware-- some items were able to be replaced but we truly do not even know how many of our personal items did not make it back to us.

I would not recommend Enviroco for absolutely anything. I wish it was possible to not even give the one star.

They have been very patient waiting for a response from my insurance. And they have went over my damages & options to repair with me in normal everyday terms that I could understand. You really couldn't ask for a better company to stand by your side & get your home back as it should be. Excellent quality of work! The Cathey Family

text: Keith Hyche and his crew did an awesome job for us recently.  It was challenging to reach the affected area, but they developed a plan and executed it perfectly. name: Kimberly Granda Anderson
text:
Keith Hyche and his team came to my home this morning and diagnosed the source of the water in my den.  They did that without charging me anything!
After a very heavy rain, there was water on my floor.  Restoration 1 was able to respond quickly, after a different place told me I would have to wait two days.  They arrived on time. They used moisture and temperature meters to track down the source of the water.  That took some time because the layout of my 1977 home is a bit complicated.  They determined the source of the water was the roof rather than the foundation.  They were thorough and spent at least an hour here.  I believe they know what they are talking about because they seemed knowledgeable and experienced.  I did not choose to have the floor boards worked on today, but at least I understand the problem.  I consider this to be excellent quality and value because I got the help that I needed as a courtesy without charge.  Thanks so much!

resp.text: We were happy to help, Kimberly! Please let us know if we can ever be of further assistance!

name: Barry Sobel

text: This group of folks were fabulous. We were able to do the demolition and they came in only 2 days, dried and treated stuff and did a great job. In a tough time this type of folks help in the difficulties of Hurricane Sally. Hooray! 5 star job.

name: tyler traficanti
text: We used Paul Davis for Mold remediation. The removal of the mold was great, HOWEVER...the person they used to put the whole house back  together( ie drywall, mudding and beadboard )was horrible. The end product is completely sub standard. We have been lied to about when it will be completed. We have been told that their guy is just doing what we have specified ( which is NOT true). And now, after waiting months and loosing revenue from rentals, their guy came back after 930pm and remudded the walls and ceilings that had just been painted(because he said that is what we wanted! which is NOT true!!) The rooms had just been cleaned and to boot it is horrible work. We have hired someone new to finish what they couldn't get done. DO NOT HIRE THIS COMPANY! The person they use for remodel work does NOT know what he is doing and sadly, the owners are standing behind him and his lies.

resp.text: We are sorry you felt so unhappy with the work completed by a subcontractor. We know there are two sides to every story and we hope you find the resolution you are looking for.

name: Amanda Ausborn
text: Paul Davis’s crew was efficient, friendly, kind, helpful, thorough, and did a great job. Great customer service skills/ great communication. 10/10 would recommend.

resp.text: It was a pleasure to take care of you Amanda

name: silvia doss
text: The most compassionate service people I ever met!!!! Camila, Mark, Mitchel, Kevin and Jared descended into our Sally flooded home in Foley and for 3 days, tirelessly  work their hearts out to address the problem, before mold could set in! Our home is 4000 sq ft  under roof, so it was a lot to handle!! They were so considerate, friendly and empathize with our situation to the point that when they finally done, we really hate seeing them going!!! I am so happy we choose Paul and Davis and would recommend them to any body in need!!! The beauty of this is the fact that you make friends out of a tragedy like Hurricane Sally! So happy they in town and we can get together one day, after all this is done and over with and we can return to normal life, and sit around a table and share a meal and memories we built during a tragic event!!! Thank you so so much and God bless you!!!!

resp.text: Thank you Mrs. Doss!! It was a pleasure to serve you in your time of need.

And the fee was reasonable as well.  Highly recommend this company.

name: Vu Le
text:
I sent a custom tailored suit in, as well as a standard white shirt, for dry cleaning and it was picked up by my girlfriend. The shirt still had obvious stains on the collar, so she left it to be cleaned again. The suit however, has somehow been ruined. It looks as though it has been put in a washer machine; the cuffs are somehow coming inside out as I wear it, and the lapel is wrinkled. There was also a stain on the back collar of the suit that I was able to take off by scratching at it.

I haven’t had any issues with dry cleaning before  and I tried this business for the first time, right before a wedding. I wish I had just waited for my usual shop to open up instead. Extremely dissatisfied.

resp.text:
Mr. Le,
I’m sorry for the problem and would very much like to bring resolution to the matter. I’m unable to locate your info in our computer system. Could you please call my office at 706-323-7774 when get a chance or send me your contact info?
Thank you.
Rhonda Eysel

name: Sa'Vaughie French
text:
I dropped off a garment to have a strap fixed on Monday as was told that it would be ready by Wednesday. It is now Friday and it's not ready. I needed this for a trip I'm taking this weekend.

Edit. Thank you to the owner for reaching out to me , personally, on Friday. It's refreshing to know that my business is important to your company. The situation was rectified and I was able to have my clothing in time for my trip.

resp.text: Ms. French, I am so sorry your garment wasn't ready when promised. I appreciate you taking my call on Friday, June 5th and am glad we were able to have it ready for you to take on your trip. We appreciate you. Kindly, Rhonda Eysel

text: Great staff to work with , I had a water leak in my home they were fast and very knowledgeable about the clean up process. text: Very friendly and knowledgeable. Loved working with them!

name: Scott Young
text: DEFINITELY RECOMMEND  APEX Restoration for any and all mitigation needs. Colby and the DKI water mitigation team did an outstanding job from start to finish.  I can't say enough about their professionalism, courtesy, care and concern for our home.  We had significant water damage from a attic mounted Air Conditioner.  The came in assessed the damage a provided us with not only a estimate but walked us through the process. They worked diligently to get our home restored as quick as possible, despite the fact that the temperature in the house was over 100 degrees.  Glad to have professionals of this caliber on our side in our time of need.

name: Richard Weaver
text: Colby and the DKI water mitigation team were rockstars!!!! They were Johnny on the spot when the city sewer backed up into our house. Very professional, very courteous, and they were very thorough. The fact that they are good at what they do is a bonus as well. Glad to have professionals on your side in your time of need. 10/10 would use again. Don’t want to HAVE to use them again, but should the need arise, they’ll be my go to.

name: Lisa Grupe
text: After Hurricane Sally damaged my new condo, DKI Apex Huntsville (Colby Swaim) was assigned to do the mitigation. Mr. Swaim was knowledgeable, personable, thorough, attentive to detail, and empathetic. He answered my questions in person, via text, on the phone, and via email. He always did what he said he would do, and he went above and beyond by sending me photos when I couldn't be present and by working with me on saving some custom cabinetry.  In a time of stress, his calm presence was very beneficial. Other condo owners expressed similar satisfaction with how neat and clean this firm was in the mold removal and water damage cleanup.  Thanks Apex DKI Huntsville!

name: Dee Dee Bond
text:
My Kitchen caught a fire in Oct. Apex did a great
Job in cleaning things up. They have 2 employees that are great works. Their kind ,organized , very hard workers. Mike and Zack are the nicest young men. Can’t find people like that these days.

name: mike smith
text: Like the others have said....if I could give a zero I would.  I have no idea why my insurance company uses Apex, other than they must be low cost.  I'm not going to waste any more of my life on these guys writing a review, but since I use google reviews I will tell you don't, just don't

name: Cameron Galbreath
text: Do not use this company. They cut corners and just want checks signed whether it's done correctly or not. There was a problem (that I personally noticed and pointed out and it was never brought to my attention by the contractor). It could have been easily fixed during the repair process but was not addressed and work that was completed now has to be undone to fix this. In addition, they have acted like this is a total inconvenience for them when they failed to notice the issue (or ignored it) in the first place. Use any other company but this one. They billed for several services they did not provide  It took over 3 weeks for anyone to even come out and evaluate/fix the issue after it was pointed out to them (they already had all of their large checks signed at this point).  And their "fix"was more like a bandaid and try and tell my wife there wont be any issues with it. Slow response times. Poor customer service. Their "customer service" team that is supposed to regular check in with you called 1 time at the beginning of the job and never heard from them again. This job was a 2-3 week job and is now on month 3. If you want repairs done timely and properly look elsewhere.

name: Amber Rausch
text: Let me start at the start of my process. I explain to them what the job was going to intel. But yet for some reason they were not listening. It took them five time coming out to my home to understand the full detail of what needed to be done. They put my repairs on the back burner as long as possible, stating that they would start this day but when it came to that day their employees were at another job. When they did come out, I was told that x y and z would be complete that day by the project manager, will only x was explained to the crew that came out and they were tasked with other jobs so they could not finish when I asked why they were not completing that days work. I was never provided samples and they wanted to charge me more for what I wanted because I had to go out and look for my own flooring, never provide with vanity or tub style before they installed them, and they claimed they did more work to the insurance company then the actual done, I fired them and finished the job for them.

name: Chest Rockwell
text:
Absolutely horrible experience with a small restoration. My insurance company recommended this company, and I'm not sure why. They are incredibly disorganized and communicate even worse. They show up when they aren't scheduled and don't show up when they are scheduled. In one case the workers just didn't show up and the PM didn't realize it until the next morning!! Too many issues to list. TERRIBLE project management and I would NEVER pay them on my own. I'm firing my insurance company (USAA) over this debacle.

Please find another restoration company if your insurance provider recommends these people, then find another insurance provider.

Go small if you want it done right. They don't do background checks, so you might have a murderer in your home. STAY AWAY FROM APEX! DKI!

name: TR
text:
APEX started our bathroom in May 2016. They said they would be done i n 7 to 10 days. As of July 20th they still had not finished. We had a vacation planned and upon our return, the unprofessional work ethic and attitude continued so we fired them.
The problems:
They have installed the tile flooring incorrectly, it is very uneven, has to be removed and replaced. The tile was uneven, grout lines not the same and tile was crooked. They chipped floor tile trying to fix the mistakes they made.
They rebuilt the shower walls but made the shower to large. The cabinets now do fit in place. The shower walls have to removed as does the mud bed for the shower.
The tile work they did on the shower had to removed because they had a 1 inch bow i n the wall. The bow in the wall was due to APEX's contractors putting inch of thin set or mortar behind the tile, inch thick!
The floor pan was not sealed or glued correctly. This was pointed out to me two other contractors who have given us bids.
APEX also did not install the left counter properly so they cut the stone back splash and side splash to try to make it fit. They cut the back splash uneven.
They broke fixtures in the bathroom.
I had to make them put insulation back in the walls.
Apex did paint behind the counters in the bathroom.
Apex contractors would show up and work for a couple of hours and then leave to g to another job. At times they didn't even show up.
I was told not to worry about the job in progress but the end result. If your foundation on the job is not right the finished product will be junk!
APEX would lie to us about job finish date. They would tell us we will be done by this Friday, but the tile had not been ordered or was not going to in till the next week.
The contractors would sit out back and smoke under my Gazebo! One of the guys had his girl friend hanging out all day. They did fire him after I brought this up.
I had to tell them to not smoke under my Gazebo, don't put your stuff on my grill, do not smoke on my porch, do not turn on my outside fans and for them to clean up after themselves.

resp.text: Please call me at (931)691-3800 I will do all in my power to resolve this issue. At DKI we strive to exceed all of our customers expectations and I am sorry that you are not happy with our services but we will do whatever it takes tor remedy this issue and make you happy.

text: Horrible, horrible!!! Do terrible work, and tell you they will be there at a time, then not there.. and no contact.

name: soule64
text: First off, a 1-star rating is too good for this company. Apex was referred to me by USAA for a water damage insurance claim that occurred in early December, and they just now finished. This was not a huge project - about 8 sheets of drywall and 2 doors, and I elected to paint, yet it still took nearly 4 months to complete. The drywall work was so bad that it took me an entire weekend to prepare it for paint. Debris was dumped in my trash can despite them billing for removal. I voiced my concerns with a quality manager, but heard nothing else after. Communication with Apex was frustratingly bad. Calls to project managers would go to voicemail and would not be returned. Weeks went by without updates despite my numerous calls and texts. I don't know how these guys are still in business, but I do plan on voicing my concerns with USAA to at least get them off their recommenced list so this never happens to another veteran.

I PLEADED WITH USAA TO NOT USE APEX FOR FUTURE WORK.  I hope this helps anyone in search of a restoration company.

name: Jennifer Varnell
text: BEWARE.  I recently had a horrible experience with this company.  I had contracted them to clean very specific parts of a rental I own but when then tenants showed up for move in, the unit was not clean.  Only one item we had agreed to was actually clean.  I then had to go to the townhouse and clean for 2 hours myself so my tenets could move in.  The floors were not swept or mopped, appliances and cabinets not wiped down as agreed. Fans and window sills filthy, even though we discussed doing this in advance and it is outlined on the invoice. I even sent them pictures.  What's worse is that even after I contacted them, they never called me back and still charged my card!  I have disputed this with my credit card company, but what a hassle.  Save yourself the trouble and get a company that will do what is right when they make a mistake. The pictures below are just a small sampling of what it looked like "after" the cleaning!

I'm a little bit of a clutterbug--they magically organize the little things like exposed cords, kitchen stuff put where it belongs--what a concept!  Tania and Allysa make things I don't even notice cleaner and better. They're also kind and considerate in my home.

name: Amanda Marcello
text:
Pretty unsatisfied with the 5-hour  "deep clean" service we had today. We hired this company to thoroughly clean a house we just purchased so it would be spotless prior to moving in. Upon arrival to our house this afternoon, right off the bat we noticed they left the garage door up with our belongings in plain view. The front door was unlocked as well. The crew was nowhere to be found.

As we looked around to see what had been done, here are just a few things we noticed:
-soap scum in the shower
-hair in the sink/tubs
-microwave not cleaned
-oven not cleaned
-things on kitchen countertops that would have easily been brushed away even if wiped with a dry cloth

We were supposed to be notified prior to the crew leaving and we weren't. I tried to call the office at 4:30 pm and no one answered.

I am very dissatisfied with the level of service. Book this company at your own risk.

name: Angelk B
text: The Paul Davis Restoration company is absolutely awesome! They did an excellent job on my house from start to finish, after I had experienced a water leak. They came out to my home and performed the mitigation process and dried my house out. They packed my household goods up and started the reconstruction process. My house looks brand new now! The team had to put in new drywall; pull up and install all new hardwood floors and floor boards; and paint my house. I was very nervous about this project, but they made it so easy for me by keeping me well informed on the entire process. They were very professional; timely; detailed and they all worked well together as a team. I was amazed at the amount of time it took for them to perform all of my work needed. I would like to thank Dennis, Miguel, Eric, Abraham and all of the contractors and everyone that was involved with my project. In addition, I had to go by the Paul Davis office and the staff there was also very friendly and professional. This company is well managed, and it shows! I am so glad Paul Davis was here for me! I will tell everyone about this company’s performance!

text:
Without question and without peer, Paul Davis Restoration of Huntsville, AL and Lead Project Manager Mr. Brian Henson, whom I call Commanding General, and the entire Staff have been nothing but SUPERB for 6 water damage claims in our home since 2017.  Every intricate detail from the paper work to the water mitigation, mold mitigation, and reconstruction has unequivocally been done with astute meticulous attention to detail.  Every payment is tracked with precision and every aspect of all the six repairs have been done to PERFECTION!!!  I had never heard of Paul Davis until USAA recommended them to us for our first water damage claim that occurred August 2017.  The most recent one was earlier this year for water damage in the kitchen and the roof.  Over 500 sq of ceramic tile had to be replaced and black mold removed from the kitchen and the crawl space due to a break in the water line from the dishwasher and internal water leaks in the kitchen area windows coming from the roof.  I can't say enough about the professional acumen led by Mr. Brian Henson and the entire Team of Professionals at Paul Davis - Huntsville, Alabama!!  They have my VOTE and Pledge to take care of any claims or normal reconstruction for my home now or in the future.

Regards,

Willene Smith Orr (AKA - PVT Smitty)
Sergeant Major, US Army Retired

text: I was in Florida when I received a call from my neighbor stating that my kitchen was wet and the laundry room looked like a bomb had gone off. The water went into my pantry, under the wood to the great room, and into the dining room. It was mess. I called Paul Davis from Florida and requested they start restoration immediately. Two days later i got home and I could not believe my eyes. There were two large storage pods in the driveway, all the furniture was removed and stored. All the cabinets and cupboards were removed, the place was completely stripped. There were big fans all over, and the rooms were blocked off from the rest of the house. Once dry, they came in with contractors and started to restore my home. The job when finished was outstanding. I love my new kitchen,  and flooring in the great room and dining room. the site manager was outstanding, he checked with me every day to make sure I was satisfied. The workers were extremely friendly, and experienced. I would recommend Paul Davis Restoration to anyone needing this kind of help. Dwight Washington

name: T S
text: DENNIS MAYNOR and the remediation crew were great on both of my claims. professional and quick with the work. I wish he would have been the project manager on my rebuild. However on the rebuild side.. not so much.. said project manager who I will not mention he knows who he is did not communicate well with the contractors on my rebuild. I had to fix AC vents myself that said project manager had told contractors to fix as I told them not to take down. they taped around them and when they took tape off. they ripped em out... they had no knowledge of it to fix them and were not told.. They damaged my drawer in my kitchen and tried to blame me for it. Broke my kitchen faucet as they should have taken the faucet from the sink.. Instead I find my sink on the floor all willy nilly . On the paint process they puled nails and picture hooks and patched but on other areas they just painted over the pic hooks and so forth. They also painted without using drop cloths on my wood floors and set a paint tray on my wood floor without a drop cloth under it. and I will have to pay someone to pressure wash my front sidewalk as they got paint spatters everywhere when they were cutting and working outside.. They did fix the items in question, drawer faucet and cabinets. but project manager said we will go thru this during the walk thru.. To me it would make sense to take care of this BEFORE THE walk thru.. I am visually impaired and I am glad I had friends to point out stuff they needed to fix.. They got it all fixed but it should have never come to that had the project manager been on the ball. Y'all need to put me on the payroll for this job. and he charged me for a Dump truck that did not get used for hauling away debris.. This was a rebuild no debris to haul away. He got snappy and angry.. "I am not taking that truck charge off"  and took it personally when I questioned the Dump truck charge. I am not trying to nickel and dime anyone I just expect things to be as they were before it happened. Said project manager was very aloof and uncaring or understanding. I might be legally blind but I am not stupid. If I was totally blind with no help my place would have been totally jacked up after the sign off. and lastly they put my upper kitchen cabinets in crooked.They had to pull and put in correctly... who does not use a level when putting in cabinets. Very hasty sloppy work that should have been done right the first time.  I understand that folks try to get over on folks like y'all but I just wanted stuff done right.. It was a very painful process Tim Seh

name: Patrick Haxton
text: After a bathroom flood, we used Paul Davis for the damage cleanup and the remodeling.  Dustin Hunt was our project manager. Very professional and took us through every step. Helped us with insurance company, picking materials, the whole process. God forbid we have another issue, we will definitely be calling Dustin again!

resp.text: Hi Patrick - We appreciate your feedback. We understand the inconvenience of a water loss, so we do our best to remove any headaches associated with the restoration process to make things as easy as possible for our customers! Please let us know should you ever need anything from us.

name: Allison Block
text: I have used Paul Davis pretty exclusively for a couple of years, and I find them to be very responsive, professional and organized in their assessments, scheduling and actual accomplishing the work I engaged them for.  They are a bit pricier than going directly to a smaller outfit, but the value in their project management, professionalism, follow-up and warranty on work performed is truly worth every penny when it comes to your home.

resp.text: Hi Allison - Thank you so much for your kind feedback! Please let us know should you ever need anything from us.

name: Kent Schroeder
text:
We had a problem with mold forming along out dining room baseboards. Paul Davis Restoration was recommended to remove the moldy materials and repair the walls. Two groups of folks with different skills and equipment were needed to effect the repair.

Phase 1: Dan Wong came to the house and took pictures and measurements and provided a detailed estimate for removing the mold. Work was scheduled soon after and workers removed the affected materials within a couple of hours and left a very large dehumidifier, four or five air handlers and a couple of HEPA filter units. After three days of continuous noise and tripped circuit breakers the walls were dried out, my allergies started clearing up and I was a happy camper.

Phase 2: Dustin Hunt came to the house to survey the "damage" take measurements and pictures, then provided a detailed estimate for reconstruction of the dining room walls. Work was scheduled soon after and workers arrived at the scheduled time and completed the work over 2.5 days since drywall and paint take longer. Now our dining room is as good as new and most important of all the wife is happy.

resp.text: Hi Kent - Thank you so much for your feedback! We are so glad to hear that you are fully satisfied with our work. Please don't hesitate to reach out should you ever need anything from us.

name: Darrell Sanders
text: Prompt and great working with Dustin Hunt. He was an absolute class act. Great job guys

resp.text: Hi Darrell - Thank you for your feedback! We pride ourselves on quality work and timeliness, so we are very happy to hear that we were able to serve you well. Please let us know should you ever need anything from us.

resp.text: Thank you, Kyle! It was a pleasure working with you.

name: Victor Markgraf
text:
What is integrity?  Doing the right thing even when no one is looking.  J Miller Restoration embodied integrity in the service they provided me.  I don't normally give reviews, but the peace of mind I received from giving this company my business is a small token of my appreciation for their concern, professionalism, and quality of work that I received from them working on a rental property I manage.

I use numerous contractors in my line of work. If you're tired (like me) of hearing sales pitches from the "big" companies about how big they are and how they're the best, then do yourself a favor and give this company a call for an estimate or a second opinion.

I don't want the biggest guy in the market; I want the guy that has a servant's heart.   Feel free to contact me for the validity of this review.  I'm difficult to impress and rarely give recommendations, but J Miller Restoration is my go-to company for water and/or mold damage.  I wish more contractors would take note of this business and imitate their high standards of customer service and clear communication.

name: Billy Jordan
text: Servpro was awesome. Came out quickly and got our crawl space dried within hours. Recommend them to anybody who needs something done right.

name: Heather McCormick
text:
Do not use this company whatever you do. I had my  rental house flood and it was the worst experience of my life using Serve Pro of Tuscaloosa.I had to call them 3-5 times to even go to the house to get the clean up  process started.Kept being told they was going out to start and when contractors went to give me estimates on repairs there would be no one at the house working on the clean up.They have lied to me several times about my property.Told me several different start and finish dates.They left drying fans in my house 7 days running after they had already cut the drywall and  insulation out. Drew one of the sales guys made up stories about the situation, told my tenant I had told him things when I hadn't even talked to the guy yet and told two different things ones to me and my tenant .I asked Drew why he did this and let him know I would be calling the office and  he proceeded to call my tenant a couple of times and send me a  6 page text over the situation which I found very unprofessional . When I called to complain about this Jacob the owners son took  up for the actions, was rude to me, did not listen to me and acted like I was bothering him.I was told my cabinets needed replaced when they did not. They pulled the vanity out of my master bathroom that did not need pulled out to begin with  without cutting the caulk and when they pulled the vanity it caused the mirror in the bathroom to fall on the sink shattering my mirror and busting my sink in the bathroom and tried to blame it on the heat in the room.I called  David the head of the construction department several times asking a start date and was told no repairs would be started  until they had 18 thousand upfront, Half the cost, and to ask my adjuster to call  his cooperate office and have Fed Ex deliver it to them.I asked my adjuster about it and he said that they did not that money upfront and was beyond shocked I had been told that.They still have their little lock box on my door a week after I told them I will not be using their services anymore, I have called four times to ask to have removed.I have called and asked  three times to speak to the owner of the franchise and got no response. The office staff is not friendly, they have horrible attitudes and make you feel  brushed off.  Brandy the girl in the office is very rude and  blows me off and acts like I'm a bother to her when I call to ask to speak to a manager or owner  . This is the most unprofessional company I have ever came into contact with in my life. And I strongly suggest people think  twice before using them for any reason. You will regret it if you  use this company, trust me on that.They thought since it was an insurance claim they would  take me for a run and rob me and  my insurance company blind and have caused me nothing  but a headache and  added stress from what happened to my home.

Chelsea
don't know how to reply to you  but this way. I too have a  job. Cant answer my phone if I'm busy.I have been trying to contact the owner since June 1st regarding all my issues when they first began.Have called several times .Today is June 20 and first attempt to be reached out to by the owner. You need  new office staff and employees that don't lie to customers and be extremely rude to them. I want my sink and my mirror replaced that was broken courtesy of your employees negligence. Thank you.

resp.text: Good morning Heather, I am deeply sorry you have not had a good experience talking with our staff. I have notified the owner, when we received your yelp review also. It looks like he tried to call about 9:00 am this morning. Please feel free to reach out at any time or email us at servpro8822@servprooftuscaloosa.com. The office has been directed to patch you through to him direct, if he is in during our office hours 8am-5:00 pm. I will follow up with him this afternoon to try and reach you again. I apologize for your less than ideal customer experience during this event in your home. The owner and I would be happy to work with you to figure out where communication errors started and how we can correct them in the future.  - Chelsea

name: Tammy
text:
They were all very sweet and helpful when they came out to our house for a house fire. But then everything got very confusing. We didn't know what was going to happen or when. Then they came in and packed all of our things up, first our clothes and no one told us to keep out any clothes. So we had no clothes blankets or pillows by the time they finished. There was 2 rooms that just had to be cleaned but they threw out our beds and furniture and took out all the carpet. We put notes on two closets and put don't enter.. I found the notes in the floor when we returned. They packed up everything and took it with them but nothing was cleaned it was just in the box they had packed it in.
They told us they we're going to clean the duck work, it was not cleaned, the ceiling fans were not cleaned nor were the blinds. We have had to just  about replace everything  we own plus we had use or own  money to eat at the hotel for   for over 2 months. Being nice is great but we had to many people telling us different things..it took a month after we got to come home before they started bring things back. It made difficult to cook. We had to buy new pots just fry an egg.
When they finally brought things back they were very confused about everything because the young guy and 3 woman that packed us up were fired. They didn't seem to know what was ours and what wasn't.  There are quite a few things missing.  Some of the items are antique and can't be replaced.  The thing is these items problem  went to someone else  and they just saw it was old and not there's. Maybe I need to go check the thrift store.  I didn't think this was going to be easy but this has been a nightmare. I have items that have tags on them, but they didn't take them or clean them. My blinds still have soot on them and it is not easy to clean. They we're supposed to clean and check or duct work , not even touched. And we saw the check our insurance sent them and that was way too much for this mess. This is the first time in 15 years we have made a claim on our house or auto  and now State Farm will not cover our house anymore. So we are going to have to sale our house and move because this put us in the red.

resp.text:
Tammy, I am so sorry for your bad experience with our crews. This is the first we have heard of any issue with your loss. We are trying to look into it internally, but would love for you to call the office at 553-8377 and let us know more so that we can get this issue resolved and make sure everything met to your satisfaction. - Chelsea

Tammy, Thank you for editing your review so that we may have a little insight on why you are unhappy with SERVPRO. I would like to also thank you for your kind words on our crews being "sweet and helpful." I can address that clothing and other textiles were cleaned by another company and not by SERVPRO of Tuscaloosa. We would like you to reach out to our General Manager and Owner at 205-553-8377 when you are comfortable and allow us to address and mend your concerns that we do have control over. Any issues between the claim and your insurance provider will have to be handled through their customer service, as our company does not have direct correlation between your insurance coverage. Again, we are sorry for the headache that was truly in control of our Franchise and the General Manager/Owner would, again, invite you to call and see how we can clear up confusion and give us the opportunity to fix what we are able to.

name: Christina Graham
text:
Please consider this review a PSA! Do NOT use this place. Perhaps if you are a corporate client, they will do well on your job. If you are individual customer, they likely will perform extremely poorly.

I was lied to on a couple of different occasions with my job, in particular about them contacting my insurance and the times that they did so. They typically arrived late (45 min to 1 hour) or on one occasion, they were so late that I was told to not even bother waiting. This was actually after being told by the person managing my job (supposedly managing it) that he thought they were finished up at my place. NOPE! Even after officially signing off that they were done, I brought in another mitigation company...and they are currently finishing the job that ServPro was hired to do.

There are major breaks in communication internally, as well as externally. I wouldn't recommend this company to my worst enemy. Please don't use them and keep them in business any longer.

resp.text: Christina, this is deeply disturbing news to read. We did not know you had any concerns during your experience with SERVPRO of Tuscaloosa. Our office deeply apologizes for your additional distress in your experience with our crews. Residential claims are very important to us as well and we strive to do our best whether we are in a residential home or commercial business. We are very sorry you feel you did not receive our best. Our owners and management are actively investigating your claim file and you will hear from us directly with more questions and information soon. We want to make sure you are taken care of properly and wish that we had known throughout the job process that you were unhappy with the crew in your home.
